remarks: Lemma for defining an emulation of Hilbert's epsilon.  Hilbert's epsilon is described at ~ http://plato.stanford.edu/entries/epsilon-calculus/ . This theorem is equivalent to Hilbert's "transfinite axiom," described on that page, with the additional ` R We A ` antecedent.  The element ` B ` is the epsilon that the theorem emulates.  (Contributed by NM, 11-Mar-2004.)  (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 25-Jun-2015.)
statement:
htalem.1 $e |- A e. _V $.
htalem.2 $e |- B = ( iota_ x e. A A. y e. A -. y R x ) $.
htalem $p |- ( ( R We A /\ A =/= (/) ) -> B e. A ) $.
$d A x y $.
$d R x y $.
